description: I LOVE this place. I walked here from my house because we live really close and I am never disappointed. You don't to come here for a fancy meal but if you want authentic Chinese food this is the place to come. The chow fun and the hot sauce are the highlights.
author: Rachel C.

description: Not so good food and not so friendly seller. I gave two because the price was reasonable for the quality and taste of the food.
author: Janine A.

description:
As much as I wanted to really like this place, it was just a mediocre overall experience. Firstly, the owner lady is really nice and friendly. I liked her a lot. She is like your older Chinese aunty (the nice one) that is quite charming and nice. Thing is I was a bit turned off my the paper plates and cups. Not only is it not environmentally friendly, it's really low class for a sit down restaurant, even for a hole in the wall. The food was tasty but salty, however, I did like the freshness of the ingredients. I would give this place another chance to try some other dishes, but for to go orders if I am in the area. 

I would say, I would like to continue and support this local business. Good people, good ingredients. Just keep your expectations low and you may be surprised.
author: David K.

description: This place is hands down the best Chinese food I've ever had. I've been coming here since 2002. The lady has pretty much seen me grow up from a child up to now. The food has such an amazing taste and I've never been able to find any place that can come close to this place. Don't let the bad reviews fool you. They seem to be picky and expect some exquisite restaurant. But you have to remember this is a mom and pop shop. What they lack in location they make up for it in the most amazing food you will ever taste. I've recommended this to numerous people and not one person has ever said anything negative. If you want great Chinese food this is the spot.
author: Larry H.

description: A great, no frills, hole-in-the-wall with delicious Cantonese food.  A big dinner for three came in at less than $40.00 (before tip).  We ordered the chicken and salted fish fried rice, beef chow fun, mandarin spare ribs, and mixed vegetables in oyster sauce.  The homemade garlic chili sauce was delicious as well.  The lady who runs this place was very warm and friendly, even though she jokingly asked me and my friends to come by earlier next time if we wanted to dine in, haha.  It's refreshing and soothing to still find places like this in modern day San Francisco.  J & A for the win!
author: Alan C.

description: Awesome service! I ordered in and the owner was kind to stay open late for us. Very delicious food at a great price!
author: Jinghuan L.

description:
J & A is one of the most affordable, yet delicious Chinese restaurants in outer Mission/Excelsior district of San Francisco.  The owners/operators Mr. And Mrs. Wong have been opening and closing the doors to their successful business for the past 26 years and counting.  They got to be doing something right, like making sure customers are :)

She always starts my meal w/ piping hot tea, a cup of hot & sour or corn soup b4 my entree arrives. While having my meal, I usually request an extra bowl of steamed white rice on the side which she never adds any additional cost to my check for this request even tho she has every right to do so.  For this reason, I always leave a bit extra to show my appreciation for her kindness and generosity.  After I'm done with my meal, she offers several slices of orange, a fortune cookie, and a piece of chocolate w/ the check.  For $8-9 plus a buck or two for tips, I can get a huge plate of Mongolian beef over steamed or fried rice, or I might order Kung Pao Chicken over chow mien, but my favorite dish would have to be filets of fish w/ fresh vegetables stir fried in garlic oil.  

I've been eating here for about only 1.5 years, and I've notice 100% inspection card hanging on the wall from Day 1 so they do run a neat & tidy ship here FASHO!!  The phone rings nonstop usually, and a good amount of their business must be for pickup since they don't deliver.  They can also prepare large trays of food for special occasions but require at least two days notice in advance.  They will even let u park in their driveway if u can't find parking nearby.  Since they owned the building as well as the business, they can afford to be more generous than the competition b/c they are not faced w/ a huge overhead that comes w/ commercial leases.  

When I'm on a budget, or I just want to grab some food really quick and easy, J & A Restaurant opens 7 days a week even on holidays.
author: Randy L.

description:
Don't let the inside fool you. 

I admit, I was a little weirded out when I first ate here. It's sort of like walking into your grandparent's house for a family event and having them serve you food that they have been preparing for hours. Paper plates and all. The owners are this nice old couple; husband in the kitchen, and the wife taking orders, serving customers, and handing out candy. Sounds strange, but this place is now one of my all-time favorites. 

Order the shrimp fried rice. It's hot, fresh, and always has a nice crispness to it. Most places drown their fried rice in soy sauce, but this is actually browned on the grill. No nasty frozen peas in this stuff! Just good ingredients, and always consistent. The hot sauce is great, too. 

Eat here! If the inside doesn't suit your taste, the grab take-out.
author: Christine S.

description: Unfortunately got food poisoning from this place, which Was just diagnosed as Salmonella. I ordered a chicken dish which I now know was a mistake. (After throwing it all up for 12 hours and being near death for the last couple of days) other than that it still got two stars because the food tasted pretty good. Don't order the chicken...
author: Chasen G.

description:
The banner is faded now and the tree may block your view when trying to locate with GPS. This place is located next to a house. Upon entering it is an in law turned into a small restaurant. It has a homey feel to it. The owners are very friendly and remind me of my grandparents. The lady was very attentive and friendly. I do not mind the paper plate (it's the heavy duty Dixie kind). You just gotta think about that this is their dream and they have to cut cost somewhere. You can not pay for a homey hospitality. The food is good and very generous. Place is small and pretty much is an in law remodeled to be a restaurant. It is only the two of them pretty much running the place. No more delivery because her kids were the ones driving. Menu has updated prices. (For those who are nit picky let me remind you that it cost money to constantly update menus so don't gripe about it being updated in writing). 


Fried calamari
Combination soup
Egg scramble with Chinese bacon over rice
Beef and oyster sauce over rice

Did I mention the food is amazing?!? Hahaha I guess you can call this place a greasy spoon place I mean what chinese restaurant isn't?
author: Mary Ann B.

description: My experience at j&A was horrible I had came in and ask the lady who was sitting in front of the tv eating if I could get a box of fried rice and asked what what size i wanted and what type of fried rice i wanted I said beef she said ok and went to the back mean while all the lights were off and took a while for them to turn back on so I sit down and wait while I'm sitting at the table I see 3 paper plates with forks spoons and nifes and I look at the plate and I see Bella dust on every thing the utensils plate and the whole table so I stand up and just wait another 5 minutes so she comes out and gives me the box and walks back to were she was sitting at and doesn't say any thing to me so then I ask if I could have a bag and a plastic fork she then say $2 and I said for a bag and fork and she says yes and i say 50 cents and she looks at me and says FINE with an attitude and I grab the bag and fork from her and leave I walk a lul bit and open my box of FRIED RICE and see steam rice so I go back there and tell her I asked for fried rice and she gets up and says no you didn't while getting in my face so tell her you asked me what type of fried rice I wanted and she says no tour lying and looks at her Wal-Mart camera on the wall and says I have it on camera and I m like you know that cheap thing got mc Donald connection and can't even pick up sounds so what you mean and then I said well can you give me fried rice now and she said no I don't have any and I say duhh your supost to Fri it fresh and she says Fine again and says well your only getting this size and it cost $4 more I said how much for a small and she says you can't get a small I say then how come.when I first came in here u asked me what size i wanted I got so pissed I told her to give me my money back and then she tried to say that she was making it right now and I didn't care so I got my money my self and left and I will never go back there period point blank. So if your worried about health concerns I wouldn't eat at that nasty dirty place ever
author: Aneesah R.

description:
Mom and Pop shop off the beaten path... I was looking for Chinese take-out with a good health inspection rating and found the only one with 100 out of 100. (And trust me you would be appalled at the scores of some of the most popular places in the city. Props to yelp for adding the inspection scores)

I would frequent this place more but be aware that...
- It's cash only
- It's a small restaurant not suited for large groups or large orders
- you will probably wait longer than what you might expect for Chinese take out
- It's Americanized Chinese food so you have to be cool with that
- Stick with mainstream items; don't order something too obscure
author: Yohdaddy M.

description: This is a small family owned restaurant with good food. The owners are really nice and they customized my order( because I'm vegetarian). The food taste good just like home-made and I really like that you can request not to add MSG in your order. I really like the food and will definitely go back again.
author: SzeWan C.

description:
So wonderful.

Once or twice a month, I phone in an order, and it's always great food and a great experience. I adore this place, and this couple. I tend to get the mongolian beef and pork chow fun, but I'm trying to branch out and be more adventurous. The hot chile sauce is phenomenal. It's one of these businesses whose product you love, and that you just can't help but root for. I wish you all the best J&A!
author: Spencer W.

description: Zero stars!! Dont come here unless your okay with serving your own soup, bagging your leftovers, eating off disposable plates cups & utensils, mediocre food and poor service. The place has gone really down hill. Very disappointed.
author: Becky L.

description:
There's not a whole lot to say about this place that hasn't been said already multiple times by other yelpers. Yep, it's a hole in the wall and you feel like your eating in someone's kitchen. The portions are large, prices are decent and the food is good but not mind-blowing. 

The one caveat I will mention is that if you're someone who is grossed out by sticky tables, sticky menus and "greasy spoons" then this might not be the best place for you. But it's definitely an experience that's different from the norm in San Francisco.
author: Isaac K.

description:
I got fooled by the yelp reviews into coming to this place for Chinese take-out. I called in to place my order and a friendly Chinese lady picked up and took my order. I ordered fried squid, hot and sour soup, Mongolian beef over rice, sing chow rice noodle, and a combination wonton noodle soup. She said it'll take about 30-40 mins and I was excited because knowing they have to make everything from scratch and it would be fresh!

When I got to this place, it definitely looked like a hole-in-the-wall. But that didn't bother me, I was looking forward to trying the food! Boy, was I disappointed. The squid was decent since it was fried. Fried food in general is good. The hot and sour soup was different from what I had at many other restaurants. It tasted ok overall. They did not separate the wonton and noodles from the soup. They just stuffed it all into a clear container which soaked everything in there... No good. The Mongolian beef wasn't spicy at all when they specifically asked if I wanted it spicy. The texture of the sauce had a bit too much cornstarch and the rice was overcooked where it was mushy. I pretty much picked out the beef and just ate that. Sing Chow rice noodle was probably the most decent entree out of all I've ordered. It was still very greasy.

I really tried to give this place a better rating and I had much higher expectations due to the highly rated reviews. The mom and pop are nice tho.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Very cheap Chinese food.  Don't expect too much coming here.  Actually, the further you lower your standards the better your experience will be because this place is totally no frills, just cheap hearty Chinese food.  

I recommend ordering the Mongolian Beef over rice.  That seems to be their best dish, and everything else is just below average.  When we visited, we told the owner that we heard abt the place through yelp, so she didn't want to disappoint and steered us to ordering the Mongolian Beef instead of anything else.  I was craving the egg drop soup with chicken, which was disappointing.  The soup had mixed vegetables in it and mushrooms!?  WTH?  Egg drop soup isn't suppose to have mushrooms and peas in it!!   However, my dining partner loved his Mongo Beef. 

The price point is very reasonable and super affordable, so I shouldn't complain for what we were paying.  But I wouldn't go out of my way for this place.
author: Sylvia K.

description: The food is ok... I've ordered there a few times and the food has been burned some what . You have to simply ask for no MSG of you don't want it on your food. Good customer service very friendly I just didn't think that charging for extra utensils, soy and hot sauce was a good idea. I have never heard of that. You get what you
author: Khaledah A.

description: I found this place on Yelp. I have been coming here for about a year now, and the food never disappoints. Yes they have paper plates but it doesn't change the way the food tastes. This is the ONLY place I come to whenever I want to eat Chinese food. The owner is really nice, they only take cash. I order the combination won ton noodle soup, chicken fried rice with extra egg, and chicken, broccoli chow mein. The prices are reasonable. I will continue to come here.
author: Denise M.

description:
Food = good.  Greasy spoon.

Service = okay.   Paper plates, is odd though.  Total hole in the wall place though. 

Prices = cheap.  You can escape with an entree for under $7.  :)
author: Fannie S.

description:
Mom and Pop operation.  Literally. The husband cooks and the wife waits and cashiers.  I've never dined in but when I need a togo dinners... This is my spot. 

Usual items: 
bitter melon with beef 
Hot sour soup
Combo pan fried noodles
author: Jason T.

description:
I LOVE this little shop, its a "hole in the wall" type of place. Nothing fancy and not busy as some Chinese fast food place can get. I've been coming here for about 3 years and I normally order the same stuff just because its good. 

I believe this is a Mom & Pop joint. The lady is super sweet and always welcoming whenever I'm there. She'll sometimes whip me up a twist to my dish...apparently what I order is boring to her. 

I think what I love about this place is that the portion size is very generous, well, maybe because a girl can chow down like the big boys. 2 entrées and a side, YES, all for me :-) 
I just hope this place continues to stay open for business.
author: Kimmi Mey S.

description:
I'm a total fan of this place.  It's like a mom and pop restaurant.  The owners are super nice (especially the lady) -  My family have made it a regular coming here.  I'm finally writing my review because I'm sure this place is where to go when you have that certain Chinese food craving.  -Great and comfortable to take family here - very chillaxing environment. You  Can dress like crap and still get great service :)    

So the first time I came here it felt like Hong Kong to me; maybe like an old time feeling like back in the days like maybe long ago feeling- i'm not sure just a nostalgic feeling - A bit cleaner version of parts of Hong Kong.  Food is great, u can request no MSG ;).  

The price is still right even though they raised maybe $1 on everything.  I mean for under 20 bucks for a 3 person full fatty meal is PRETTY GOOD!!!  

She's so nice always giving candies and fortune cookies for happy endings too :) 

Tip:  Their hot sauce is like homemade or mixed and it's very good- the one in the tall container not the shorter one.  

There's a few dishes that are popular; they are good.  Ask her what it is when you order and she'll tell u recommendations :)  I always feel like I made the right choice after eating here and leaving from this restaurant.  The owner is so GENUINE and down to earth- no fake smile or fake talk.  that's how i like it.
author: Juila L.

description:
At this point, I'm biased, so here are some quotes from people that I've recommended the place to:

It is as if I at were eating at someone's house.

Wow! They have a really high health score.

It tastes homemade.

It's the best fried rice in the city. They don't rely on soy sauce to color their fried rice. They actually brown ever grain of rice to give it a nice flavor and crispness. The shrimp fried rice has perfectly cooked shrimp.

I like the owner a lot. She's super friendly and has even described the cooking process to us.

One of my favorite dishes is the pineapple spare ribs. It is a better version of sweet and sour pork. The meat has a firmer texture. The owner described the dish as being very popular in Hong Kong, but almost unheard of here. It takes about fifteen minutes to make. She described it as a three step cooking process. 

They also make their own hot chili sauce.
author: Jeff H.

description:
the happy hour would be 3 star or less, as it wasn't really worth it.  I think the drinks there were not that good.
But for regular meal, I found a dish I really liked, Curry rice with Beef/beef tendons.  Big bowel of rice, spicy and not so sweet curry (not like Japanese curry), tender big pieces of beef.  It was so satisfying.  I cleaned the bowel.
author: Jim T.

description: I have never been to an establishment that made me feel so happy, the owner was absolutely adorable and the food was amazing. I live in Marin and from now on I will have no problem driving all the way to Daly City just because of the experience.
author: Victoriaa T.

description: Best Chinese food in Daly City .. This lady is awesome... It's a hole in the wall restaurant nothing upscale about it but the food is delicious. Went there the first time a year ago and this is The place I go for Chinese food period ... haven't  tasted anything I didn't like . Perfect for family catering and decent pricing.
author: Marcus M.

description: The folks who run this place are super nice and cute.  If I could just rate them, I'd give them 5 stars!  But the food... You know, it's good and all, it's just not worth going out of your way for.  I had the curry beef on rice, and it was a LOT of food, but really quite bland.  I also had some pork noodles which were pretty yummy, but again, I'd never order them again.
author: Jon E.

description:
You do get a lot for how much you pay.

I didn't think their food was the best of the best. I don't think it's bad but it's nothing above your normal standard Chinese fare. The location is lightweight ghetto, there aren't many seats (I think a lot of people take out) and you get paper plates as apart of your utensils.

The service, as it is a small mom and pop, is phenomenal. The owner took the time out to talk to me about her kids and them growing up and how she's trying to put them through school. My tea never ran dry and we were asked about our lives and what we were up to.

It's an interesting experience, like seeing a relative after a long time. So they make you some food and you guys play catch up.

I wouldn't mind eating at J&A again but I don't think they're super special. Maybe they should start delivering, I think they'll get a good following.
author: Winè C.

description: I love this place!  The food is amazing and the owners are so nice.  Not really a place for sitting down and eating as it is a very small hole in the wall, but that's okay because, again, the food is amazing!  Not to mention it has had a consistent great score on the health departments website so you know they are clean.  My favorite is the sweet and sour pork, it's so crispy and delicious. The lady doesn't put on the sauce till you get there so it stays as crispy as possible.  You just can't beat this place... Nom nom!
author: Andrina H.

description: Just watched the cook drop a piece of broccoli, pick it up off of the floor and continue cooking with it. Money refunded.
author: Tynesha B.

description: First time here. I ordered take out for shrimp fried rice and chicken chow fun, no onions. Walked in and definitely a hole in the wall. Older lady sitting at the last table was busy deveining shrimp. My order was not ready and could hear them cooking up my order. The older woman was nice and received very good service. The food was still HOT when I drove home in 10 minutes. It's your average Chinese food, very good, although not mind blowing, and at 9 pm on a Monday night, it satisfied my greasy cravings. The fried rice was a little darker than I wanted it to be, maybe too much soy sauce added? Really, no complaints here. Would come back and try another dish!
author: Ny H.

description:
I can't get over how nice the lady is here! When I was getting ready to pay, the total was a few cents over $20 (for 3 dishes! = great prices). I only had two twenty dollar bills which I was hoping to break so that I could give tip and the lady just took one twenty, smiled and said, "see you next time." I insisted that we get change but she said it was no problem for her. I was able to find a couple of dollars and I still gave it to her anyway. I could see that she didn't even care about the tip and was just happy cooking and serving food to people.

With that, our service was great and this restaurant is definitely one of your hole in the wall Chinese restaurants. I tried the special chow mein, salt & pepper spare ribs, and the salt & pepper fish over rice. Chow mein was soft and salty just enough and wasn't extremely greasy. Both salt & pepper dishes were served with onions, bell peppers and jalapenos which is not very typical of salt & pepper dishes since they usually just come with jalapenos and green onion. Yet the onions were cooked perfectly where they were still sweet and still had a great crunch to them. The spare ribs were very yummy and although the fish was also good, the were cut into big pieces that reminded me of the fish that comes with fish & chips. Both dishes also could have been a bit spicier but overall, very good food! P.S. - cash only.
author: Maya S.

description: Yelp users, YOU LIED!!!  Saying this place is so good, blah blah blah.  This place is Disgusting!!  I should have went to the place next door, it's pricey but 100x better than this spot!!!  I ordered hot sour soup and Kung pau chicken.  The soup tastes like straight up vinegar and the Kung pao was soggy and gross.  Never ever again!!!!
author: Senia F.

description: We loved lunch here.  The owner is very nice. Her food is good too.  Had the cod and rice. Very tasty.
author: T H.

description: Small restaurant, but they make some good food though. I've been going there for over 25+ years, mainly for take outs. The owners are very nice and courteous. I can ask them to make special personalized dish and they have no problems doing so, if you have high blood pressure, ask them to reduce the salt (no problem), if you are a diabetic, ask them to reduce the sugar (no problem). Give them a try, you may be surprised. When my dog was getting very old, I even requested a dish of nothing but beef just for him all the time, just to make my dog happy, they had no problems with that either. VERY nice people & great food, great service.
author: Brain Fart ..

description:
Very good Chinese Restaurant that is affordable, owned by husband and wife where the wife has limited english but somehow would always make the customers giggle with her english, very nice lady, very good food, highly recommend mongolian beef over pan fried noodles. Highly recommend if you want good food, don't expect too much for the location, this is like a typical chinese small restaurant back in china or even in the philippines. 

If i ever go in the area, this would be one of my favorite chinese food places to go to
author: Mychee J.

description: We went here based on the high reviews. We ordered the salt and pepper pork chops and the fried rice. The fried rice was delicious but the pork chops were a bit gamey. Tea was also weak. I don't recommend you eat here with all the AMAZING Chinese food options throughout the city. The prices also don't match the divey-ness of the joint. Noodle soups are in the 7 dollar range and entrees are around 11 dollars. You are better off going to a dive in the Outer Sunset such as Winn's on Taraval where the prices are 2 to 3 dollars cheaper, food is served on proper plates and utensils, and the food is 100 times better. We are still looking for a good Chinese dive in the Outer Mission/Excelsior area. Suggestions anyone?
author: Amy S.

description: Nice spot, hole in the wall and decent food.
author: Roger M.

description: Really yummy food, but it's the hospitality that's awesome. I stayed quiet because I don't know Cantonese and I let my friends order everything for me, but that lady is SO NICE! It felt like I was eating in someone's home as a guest. Before we left she made sure that we were full first because it was cold out. D'aw! It's straight up delicious Chinese food in one of those places that you don't expect will be a good idea, but hey - whatever works. Cash only, I believe, so make sure you stop by the ATM first.
author: Robbin A.

description:
J&A has that laid-back, hidden nostalgia. I can't remember the last time I was at a restaurant with the Chinese zodiac on paper place-mats. Well, at least a non-hipster place that didn't descale their decor to up-sell their food. How does that work, anyway?  

Sometimes the idea of small, unpopular restaurants conjures ideas of mystery meat and questionable health conditions. Not here! There seems to be a solid turnaround. The food is good.

The space is pretty clean with a viewable kitchen space. Also, the owner is very nice. Want to feel congratulated elementary school style? She ends your meal with fresh fruit and party-size candy! Now that's classic mom & pop.

The menu prices need to be updated because their price disclaimer is confusing; essentially, everything was actually an additional $1-2 more. Cash only.
author: Diane N.

description: I ordered take out last week, and I was very impressed!  The woman who own's this place is loud and funny! Shes cool!   The food was super delicious-- "hit the spot"  I highly recommend this place if you want some good Chinese Food.  Cons- cash only and no ATM in the restaurant, also no Walnut Prawns :[
author: Monique T.

description: I live a few minutes away from this place, and I was craving Chinese food, I decided to try this place out. I went with my mom and my stepdad, and we ordered the sizzling rice soup, the vegetable chow fun, and the cod with curry sauce. The waitress was a very friendly Chinese lady who seemed to be the owner as well (her husband was cooking in the kitchen. The food was all good, but nothing special, and the portions were large as well. Would probably give the food 3.5 stars,  but bumped it up to 4 for the good service.
author: Hannah G.

description:
Do you ever notice that many Chinese restaurants have signs or menus touting "excellent Chinese cuisine"?  In general, most of them should be charged with false advertising.  J & A has a rag tag outdoor sign (see Google maps) and a menu with pasted on prices.  Their to go menu advertises free delivery, however, since it is just a ma and pa shop, that is not correct.  They have long hours and are open 7 days a week.

When our luncheon with a neighborhood couple fell through, my wife surprised me and took me here.  We have been looking for a replacement Cantonese cuisine ever since the "old" Kams on Balboa went out of business.  J & A is not quite there, but it is certainly a lot better than many that we have tried.

Driving on Mission Street, you won't even notice the place unless you are actively looking for it.  It looks like a converted residence.  The interior is narrow and rather grimy with stained walls, linoleum floors, and formica tables.  Seating is limited and the waitress is the ma while the cook is the pa.  Payment is cash only.

She was very friendly and when we placed our order, she immediately brought us some complimentary soup of the day.  Many Chinese restaurants soup of the day consisted of a thin broth with a piece of floating vegetables or some fatty meat.  However, this one had chunks of corn, tofu, carrots, green onions and eggs.  It was very tasty.

We ordered sizzling rice soup ($6), mongolian beef over rice ($5.50), beef with broccoli ($6.50), and J&A special chow mein ($6).  Our meals came on regular porcelain plates and bowls, but our we were handed paper plates with well-worn silverware to eat from.

The sizzling rice soup arrived and our waitress dropped the hot rice onto to the bowl of soup.  We knew that we had ordered too much and didn't finish the soup, but ate most of the sizzling rice since it gets too soggy the next day.  The soup had chunks of beef, bbq pork, zucchini, carrots, green onions, broccoli, etc.  It was tasty, not like the old Kams, but still good.

The mongolian beef was good, but not as spicy as we expected.  It had chunks of bell peppers, and hot red peppers poured over a bed of rice.  The beef and broccoli was also good, but then what could go wrong with this dish?  Our chow mein noodles were similar to what I have made.  The dish had chunks of beef, pork, shrimp, cabbage, onions, etc.  These 3 dishes were very well prepared and not too salty.

Of course, if you are trying to impress a first date, expecting white table cloths and stuffy waiters, this is not the place go.  But if you are interested in excellent food and can tolerate the decorative issues, then this is the place to eat. 

 We will be back.
author: Robert J.

description:
Directly off my facebook:

"Called a favorite Chinese restaurant and ordered a Mongolian noodle dish. I asked for extra hot sauce and I emphasized in Cantonese "I mean A LOT".

She calmly replies: "I know who you are, and I understand."

:))))))))))))))))))"

Order Mongolian beef over rice or if you're feeling noodlely, you can get deep fried noodles instead of the rice. The sauce makes some of the noodles perfectly soggy and delicious but other parts remain crunchy and DELICIOUS!!
author: Simon S.

description:
BEST little mom & pop place in San Francisco.  I'm so upset I found this place so late when it's literally down the street from my place (I could walk here!).  They close at 9 & I came in at around 8:30. The owner-lady asked if we were doing take-out or dine-in & she asked if we could do take-out because they were getting ready to close (not a big deal since we were planning on taking it home anyways). The best part? she felt bad and was apologizing for having us do take-out instead.  She is just the sweetest little thing (reminds me of my mom!). Also when we had to go grab cash (it's cash only) she felt so bad and said next time she'll put a bigger sign LOL I would really love to try dining in here someday. I think their service will probably be one of the best for a chinese restaurant.

The food was sooooooooo good.  The little chili sauce she has (and recommends) for the entrees were the best little compliment for them.  I think that was what made the entrees so good (we got mongolian beef & a chicken dish I can't seem to remember the name!!!!) 

also instead of fortune cookies, we get chocolate, +1 for them!!!!
author: Alice L.

description:
I've been going to this joint for more than 15 years.

It's amazing. The food is always delicious and the people are always so friendly. They have the best beef wonton soup. Everytime I pass in SF, I always want to go there! It's a nice friendly place and the plates are very reasonably priced. Fresh food--delicious food and great people. I will keep going there!
author: Natalie M.

description: I have been going to J&A for 10+ years and the food just gets better and better . The lady is so friendly and remembers all my family . And the food is the best for a small restaurant you def get your money's worth. I grew up in the neighborhood and moved away 15-20 minutes away but when I crave Chinese I don't mind driving to pick it up. The only thing I wish they took was credit card because I don't always carry cash with me . Otherwise the food is GREAT!!!!!!
author: Ed P.

description: Pretty good. This would be a 3 star review if this restaurant were located anywhere else. It's cheap, and better than golden wok.
author: Joseph O.

description:
More at 3.5 stars but rounding it up to 4 for being somewhat one of a kind.  I honestly don't think J & A is a 5-star "as good as it gets" type of place.  Maybe I ordered the wrong dishes or maybe this place has 5 stars for being the best around the area?  The food is good though, just not the best ever!  I'd still come back to try more dishes.  

I came here because my sister had been bugging me, telling me this is her favorite spot because it's so cheap (YES it is cheap and FYI - CASH ONLY)!  J & A Restaurant is a straight up mom&pop/hole-in-the-wall type of place.  The boyfriend joined me for lunch.  We were greeted by a sweet Chinese lady and her husband - very friendly service.  The table setting is something I'll definately remember about this place lol - "Mexican Fiesta" place mats and paper plates...say what!?  It was like we were at a fast food restaurant but not.

We ended up ordering the Combination Family Dinner A: 
- Wonton Soup (pretty good)
- Egg Rolls (kind of oily but loved the crunch; came with sweet & sour packets)
- BBQ Pork Fried Rice (dry and burnt looking; not really my favorite)
- Sweet & Sour Pork (good and crunchy)
- Beef with Oyster Sauce (needs a little more flavor)
- Dessert: sweet oranges, fortune cookie, and mini snickers

I think we would've enjoyed it more if we ate our dishes with plain white rice instead of fried rice.
author: jesiree b.

description:
A simple Mom and Pop dive with no msg  and no delivery.  There is a Spanish menu se habla espanol.  There is nothing fancy here, but the hot chili oil sauce is homemade and garlicy and awesome.

They're in their 23 or 24th year of running this place and is going to retire in their 25th so you better try it soon.
author: Jennifer L.

description: For the first time in a long time, if not ever, I was disappointed by the 4 and a half star review for this spot. My grandmother and I we're looking for something quick yet yummy to eat for lunch and that was nearby, so judging from the great reviews, we tried J&A. We we're a disappointed from the service, first and foremost. *Note that it is cash only here!* the review stayed it was a one-dollar-sign, inexpensive place to eat, but from the menu, they hiked their prices up by at least $2 more per entree! I was appalled at how much their food was because we're so used to getting Andy's Chinese food that is well-priced and delicious at the same time. J&A's westlake beef soup was saltier than expected, and the beef with brocolli dish was messily put together on a paper plate. The service wasn't great, but I do respect that it is a small mom & pop business. Our check was given on a ripped out piece of paper place mat, and we we're never checked on during our meal or almost ignored when we asked for to go boxes. Overall, the food was not as great and didn't meet four-and-a-half star expectations.
author: Desiree S.

description:
Great 'dive' Chinese food.  Dive by setting, not by menu.   Handmade by mama on the spot.  Literally.   She comes out, talks to you, you can see into the kitchen (big plus) and the food is fantastic for budget, no any, american style chinese food.    Don't expect Peking Duck, Dim Sum or Shark Fin soup here.

The place is a little dingy and yes they serve dishes on 'real' plates but give you paper plates for your own.  We asked Mama and she said she was too old to be washing too many dishes, her hands hurt.    Yup.  If you in the neighborhood it is definitely worth the stop.

Oh and Cash Only.
author: Lex L.

description: Spent $8.50 for prawns and vegtables on rice. Food was amazing. There was enough food for both my wife and I. You can't beat this place for great prices and fantastic food.
author: Tom S.

description: I've had a couple of other dishes from here since my first review and they were just as yummy.  I got takeout each time. It has become one of my go-to places. Beef with vegetables and mushrooms over rice is becoming one of my regular comfort food choices. The ingredients have always been super fresh.
author: David D.

description: My bf and I love J&A! It's home style cooking. Owner is very nice. She reminds me of my grandma. Their fried rice/noodle is super yummy:) highly recommend!
author: Vivian C.

description: It is a good place to eat if you like Chinese food. Amazing. The good is so delicious, and the waiter is very nice to me
author: Yalong D.

description:
That is the nicest old asian lady ever.

The food is cheap, just as you'd expect from a mom and pop chinese restaurant. Food is better than most as well.

not only do you get a fortune cookie at the end, but you get a fun sized candy bar! Huzzah!
author: Denny P.

description: My bf and I love this restaurant! Very affordable and delicious Chinese food, which reminds me of the Chinese food I had in China. The owner is a very nice lady. My bf always order the Mongolian beef over rice extra spicy and I like the BBQ pork & veggie over rice. Highly recommend this place!
author: Weiyan G.

description: Been coming here since I was a kid.  Good food for the price.  I've been to plenty other Chinese restaurants and paid way more money for worst food
author: Joe B.

description: Everything I tried here the food taste very bland. Most of all. its is extremely oily. The only reason why people come here is because they give you a lot and the food is not that expensive. For under 6 dollars you get a huge portion of food.
author: Aniko N.

description: Solid ma and pa greasy spoon style Chinese restaurant. Ma serves the food and she is very nice, hooks you up with some orange slices. Remember cash only.
author: Ben H.

description: Read all the reviews and thought this has to be a Home Run.  Not even close.  Food super greasy.  No fountain drinks and just a big disappointment.  Had the sweet sour pork and it was so chewy I actually had to spit it out.  Sorry to those who love this place but I just thought it was out right disgusting.
author: Tracy N.

description: A star for being a restaurant for the locals close by to walk to. But definitely is not a restaurant to drive to. Restaurant is really run by the really sweet old lady but they raised their prices and it's just not worth it.
author: Cat T.

description:
I don't know how on earth this place got 4 stars!!! 

I was super excited to try this place out since the reviews were so good. I'm a big supporter of mom n pop shops; I really wanted to like them!

i didnt. 

paper plates and mediocre food. i guess its the go-to spot for those in the area. (not my area. i wont be back.)
author: Lisa N.

description:
Yes, it's a mom and pop restaurant. But it's only with these small mom and pop restaurants do you get the full flavors of authentic Chinese dishes.

As for my order, I decided to go with the Roast Duck with Wonton Noodle in Soup for take-out. Eating it as I review and it's full of flavor, tons of ingredients, and just reminds me of my mom's homemade cooking. She even gave me a mini snickers bar; now I just thought that was cute.

Overall, great place to go for something that's not too pricey and fills the stomach well.
author: Johnny H.

description:
This mom n pops hole in the wall restaurant is scrumptious! It's not hard to find, but is easily missed if you weren't looking for it. I drive past this place daily and never noticed it. I was starving so I decided to hop on Yelp to find a neighborhood goodie. (That's why i forgot to take pictures...) The first one on the list was J & A! The bf & I drove down there (3 blocks in 40 degree weather? No way!) and was quickly greeted by a friendly chinese housewife type lady. She cracks jokes too! There are a lot of regulars that order to go; probably because they, like us, live a couple blocks away. 

We ordered szechuan chicken, salt and pepper spare rib, and chinese broccoli beef. They were all delicious! The jalapeno they used in the salt and pepper spare ribs we're spicy! It was a little bit too salty but the bf said it was perfect. It isn't your average spare rib either. They have their own way of cooking it. They also have a signature hot sauce, but i forgot to try it. I'll eat the leftovers for dinner tomorrow. Yum! :D
author: Wendy L.

description: The woman who runs this fine establishment refused the tip I tried to give her when I came and picked up my order and instead I was given a hug. This was a truly warming experience and spoke volumes about the person behind the food. I would come back any day. The food is some of the best in the area
author: Joe M.

description: Been coming here for years. The owner always picks up when I call and knows exactly what I'm going to order potstickers ,egg rolls , broccoli beef ,Mongolian beef and bbq pork fried rice. I believe they make the best potstickers and egg rolls that I've ever had. I love their cooking and I can't find a restaurant that cooks the food like they do since I moved across the bay. It is a hole in the wall I've never dined in there only take out. I miss this place!
author: Ashley S.

description:
Absolutely LOVE this place!
Its a small little spot. whit THE BEST Chinese food EVER! The owner is a cute Little lady who personally takes your order and makes sure you have a good experience. She always seems happy and always sparks conversation.

I have tried nearly everything on the menu and it is all delicious. The only warning is don't eat regularly, or all the different dishes will seem like the exact same dish. But even if it is its cooked perfectly and the prices are extremely reasonable. If you eat in ask for the soup of the day! Her soups are always AMAZING! She always leaves you with a parting gift of candy and a fortune cookie.

Oh! One negative that will not reflect on My rating,  the place is small so your conversations can be heard through out. If you go on a quite day then no problem, but sometimes people who don't care who hears what tend to crash and chill for a bit. I don't want to turn any one away from dinning in but that's about the only thing that keeps me from returning. I Will definitely give the food five stars any time. its super fast, super good, and super fresh!
author: Jessica T.

description:
It's like eating mom's homemade cantonese american food but better. I have to say, it's a small place, and it's definitely not impressive inside, but I am not eating Chinese food for the decor, I am looking for the best Cantonese Chinese American food that I can find, the problem is for me, I live in San Jose! Need I say more...it's not a plethora of excellent restuarants down here. We do get sunshine though!
So I am game to drive 45 miles North and further if need be to get my fix. Look, I have to say, the prices are right, about $5.50 for most dishes, and yes, you are handed two paper plates to eat with, one for me and one for my g/f. The entrees do come with real plates and the food, I ordered, pan fried pork dumplings, sweet and sour pork, and tomato beef chow mein. Big servings, excellent taste, just Like I dreamed of, and she even threw in the side of white rice (large bowl) because I drove in from San Jose, she was worred about the fuel cost!
Its CASH only so bring your cash money and enjoy this place, there are few treasures like this and when you find one, its truly a pleasureto enjoy. I drive up now every weekend!
author: O H.

description:
When i drove by this place, it looked like a tiny run down chinese restaurant but then again i was hungry and wasnt being too picky. After too much burritos and Pho i decided i would give this place a try

Ordered the Mongolian beef *my personal favorite* and it didnt disappoint! it was so flavorful and had a generous amount of food for its price. Had a great meal for only 6 dollars!
author: Kevin W.

description:
What a fantastic restaurant! Located in the heart of San Francisco for price, quality, and service it doesn't get better than this. As soon as you walk in the woman to owns the shop seats you at a table set with Mexican placemats and hands you a menu. Each plate is $5 or less and for $10 you can eat like a king, any more than that and you will be taking home leftovers.

The food is cooked quickly, and is fresh in a way that only a small restaurant can produce. It tasted like each piece of meat had been selected for the dish. The tea is great and potstickers are huge! Everything about this place is fantastic.

Remember to bring cash, and if you didn't then go get some! From beginning of meal to end, which is a fortune cookie and a Baby Ruth you will be satisfied!
author: Will B.

description: Very typical Cantonese food, the taste is not that great, but it's so cheap and the portions are really big.
author: Ji C.

description: Definitely a great place to get good Chinese food!! I love the BBQ pork fried rice! Omg their sweet and sour pork is pretty good also! After a night of drinking, the wonton noodle soup is the perfect hangover cure. If you go on a date, make sure to order the fried calamari!! You'll def be getting some if you give her some! Haha jk! But this is the place to grab some good quality Chinese food not like those other places on mission!
author: Jimmy W.

description: I hate to say it but I think they're closed for good?! We pulled up at like one in the afternoon and the face front was covered by one of those full sheet metal gate things. So sad bc this was the best chinese food we've found yet!!!
author: Kristine S.

description:
I've been going to j&a for as long as I can remember since I live so close. It's one of my all time favorite places. It's convienient, affordable, welcoming. I always enjoy going there. Unfortunately, they don't deliver, but it's ok. If you want some good food, it's worth the drive,walk, or bus ride.
I totally recommend this place. And if you ever go and it's crowded, just shows how worth it it is. It's very small but cozy. And if you don't want to sit down, I recommend calling in your order and picking it up.
author: Michelle V.

description:
My go-to when I am jonesing for Chinese!! My boyfriend and I discovered this place after work on a Sunday. We were both craving Chinese take-out and took a chance on this tiny little place. The restaurant is very small and owned by a middle-aged married couple. They are so sweet and friendly. She always gives us extra fortune cookies and candy! We get the same thing everytime: potstickers, orange chicken, chicken fried rice, and mongolian beef. 

Potstickers-Juicy and delicious, they have a nice sear on the outside and are the perfect starter for a meal
Orange Chicken-I love the freshness of the orange chicken and the fact that there are orange slices in the sauce
Mongolian Beef-Good sauce, crisp veggies, and delicious flavor! Don't be afraid to ask for more spiciness if that is your preference.
Chicken Fried Rice-Yummy, plainly put. 

I love this place so much, even though it has Mexican placemats on the tables. Looks can be deceiving, so don't be afraid to try this place out. I'd advise to always order take-out though since there's only three tables in the actual restaurant!
author: Khanh C.

description:
I tried this today after I read the reviews and it lived up to it.... Mongolian beef on rice was bomb along with the pot stickers!

It is a straight a mom and pop operation and a good one!
author: Eric S.

description:
I got lost trying to find this spot and ended up circling around it for a good 20 minutes because the place was so small and hidden.

But it has HUGE flavor.  Real good Chinese dishes, run by a lovely old lady and her husband.  They're soo cute.

Anywho, the dishes were amazingly good.  The mongolian beef, pan fried noodles, fish fillet with veggies are all a must-try.  But, the food was so good, I bet it's all worth a try.  Their home-made chili garlic sauce is so delicious.
author: Chai S.

description:
Great mom & pop good ol' chinese food home cookin'.  So If you want to grub at an affordable price (with NO MSG btw), this place is the spot to try.  I love the fact that they give ample amounts of food and if you order to-go, the boxes are real nice to use again (like tupper ware); not like the other restaurant(s) down the streeet that let your food/oil leak straight through the box! (i'm not naming names) hehe.

Also if you're not too fond of the Mission St. area, be comforted to know that they do offer take-out/to-go orders by phone.  Always a good idea to take the menu after you're first visit, so you're prepared to know what to order by phone next time.  Grant it, keep in mind it IS a family owned chinese restaurant, so be patient with the person taking you're order (they're nice folks).

I've been eating here for 8 years now and I gotta say my favorites are:
1) the egg rolls
2) crispy pan fried noodles 
3) salt & pepper prawns
4) fried squid / calamari
5) the homemade garlic hot sauce (it's not on the menu) but it's at the table if you eat there (i think they may charge if you ask for it to-go) but it's SOOOO good!!!!

bon appetit! or as they say "sihk faahn!!!" :)

PS: i don't think they deliver unless it's a BIG (party-style) order. just call in first to be sure.
author: Cheryl V.

description:
Food is fresh and made to order. She even asked us how hot we wanted it. Coming for the LB area, I was a little afraid of the small mom and pop set up. But, the food was delicious. The lady taking our order was so nice. It was cold out so she offered my hot tea while we waited for our food to go. 

Definitley worth trying.
author: Ty H.

description:
J & A Chinese Restaurant

We started to go to this fantastic Chinese restaurant in 1993 when our 1st son was only 2 years old. I used to own my Martial Art school across from this restaurant.  A few of our students & I drive down there for our lunch on every Sunday. 

Ocassionally, we go there for our dinners on Tuesday or Saturday evening. Also, we order some food to go from this restaurant. 

The 2 owners, a husband & wife work so hard to operate this Restaurant.
 
One Sunday on every month we conduct the monthly sword study meeting at this place. When approximately 10 of us arrive at this restaurant, the table is already set up and ready to order and eat. We always have various vegetables for our appetizer followed by our individual meal. They do not use the MSG ( Monosodium Glutamate ) for their cooking.

They serve us many cancer prevention leafy green vegetables ( Pea sprouts, Baby Bok Choy, bitter melon, asparagus, bean sprouts, etc. ) Some vegetables are good for diabetic person. They also have fried chicken, fried prawns ( Entire body or tail portion ) and fried squid as excellent appetizers. I do not eat out often, however, this is the only restaurant we go with our students & family members since their location is near our home and our Martial Art School in the Mission Street area.

A few of our favorite plates: 
1. Shrimp Chow Mein 
2. Curry fish over rice 
3. Wong Ton noodel soup 
4. Curry chicken over rice 
5. Curry prawns over rice 
6. Mongolian beef over rice 
7. Scrumbled egg & shrimp over rice 
8. Hong Kong style cripsy noodle with vegetables 
9. Mixed vegetable fried rice and much much more ! 

Now they have a new menu since December 24th, 2010.  The crispy fried onion rings !

We celebrate our student's birthday party every month at this place. A few times, we had over 20 people attended. All the tables were connected and we ate their excellent food. We usually playe some nostalgic music from the 1960's with our vintage electric guitars & amps.  Ocassionally we have a special singer during the birthday party.

Highly recommended !! The price is reasonable and affordable !! 

For anyone who is health conscious, visit this restaurant for lunch or dinner ! 

A message from Harunaka Hoshino / The President of the Japanese Sword Society ( SFNS ) and Japanese Sword Restoration Center / The scholar of Japanese culture, history & language / The practitioner of Karate, Ken-jitsu ( Sword fighting skills ) & Tameshi-giri ( Test cutting skills with live swords ) since 1959 / Living in the Mission street area since 1971.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Japanese sword appraisal ( Kantei ) available at this restaurant:

Day:  Any weekday ( Monday to Friday ) including Sunday morning or afternoon

Time: from 11AM to 12 Noon or 1 to 2 PM ( Please specify the exact time )

Call for an appointment: 415-585-9499

The appraisal fee is free for the SFNS ( San Francisco Japanese Sword Society ) members and associates.

The appraisal fee for the non-member is $15 per blade.

Absolutely, we are able to provide the instant, accurate, true & honest Japanese sword appraisals for your Japanese sword since we are not buying your precious Japanese sword(s).
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
author: Harunaka H.

description: I ordered the roast duck wonton noodle soup and the portion was so big I almost fell out of my chair when the lady brought it out. No one thing was particularly out of this world but everything combined is bigger than the sum of its parts. Very much akin to homecooking. The trip out of the Mission district was well worth it. The lady also came to my table on on her own, giving me the check (written on some paper-towl like product) and packing up my remaining food in a  to-go container without me even asking. In all other circumstances I would deem that extremely rude but at that moment, I was so memorized by her food that I was equally awed by her psychic abilities, and happily surrendered myself to her caretaking.
author: pH R.

description:
Delicious!! Best Chinese food I've had in the city!  Only tried it out from the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint at all.  I'm salivating just thinking about it!  I got the pineapple chicken, beef tomato chow mein, bbq pork with broccoli, and pot stickers.  All for myself!  It only lasted 2 days, too.

+1 bonus point for the elderly Chinese man rapping on the TV set in the restaurant as I waited for my order to be stacked up.
author: T. O.

description: Kind of a dump, but the food is off the charts. Four stars because of atmosphere, five stars for food
author: Michael L.

description: This place is awesome. Great food and a lovely server. May not be an upscale or even conventional restaurant setting for that matter but if you want great food without fuss this is the place to go. The older couple who owns this place are so sweet it's hard not to love the place!
author: Liz P.

description: Mongolian beef is good but they don't give much.  Better getting it @ Manila Oriental or Pacific Super food deli.
author: Sonny Q.

description: when i found this place, i was pretty happy about it. they had huge portions and the food wasn't too bad. however, the last and final time i went there, they basically served us rotten fish. i think it was partly our fault because my dad wanted a whole fried fish for some reason but when i went to eat the fish, it had a distinctly rotten smell. we told the management and all they could do was say they didn't know that. shouldn't you always check your food before you serve it to a customer? my dad was a bit too nice and told them it was fine but it was completely unacceptable to me because i could have gotten extremely sick. sorry J&A but i'm never coming back.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
This is a great Chinese Restaurant!  Yes, the food is normal, deep fried American Chinese food, but that doesn't stop it from being the best Chinese food I've ever had.  The Sweet and Sour pork was amazing:  totally melt-in-your-mouth tender.  The only comparison I can make is like excellent BBQ pulled pork, but this was large chucks of pork, deep fried, and covered in tasty Sweet and Sour sauce.

The lady who owns the restaurant is really nice!  As you chat while you wait, you can hear her bustling about in the kitchen behind you, making your food fresh like mom used to.  The difference is here, the food is cooked to perfection (no offense mom) and you don't have to do dishes afterward.

However, the best part was that she gives you a Bite-sized Baby Ruth with your fortune cookie.  How cool is that!?

One caveat:  they take only cash, so if you don't have some with you, head down the block to the 24 hour laundry place for an ATM.  It's the closest one nearby.

I recommend it to anyone looking for Chinese food is the Bay Area.  Doesn't get much better than this!
author: Nicholas C.

description: Great place to eat if you want the real good Chinese food. My fave is the pan fried noodles and salt and pepper prawns! Service is awesome and they can customize your order to anything you want. This place is family owned and they know how to take care of their customers. I don't live nearby, but whenever we are in the area, we always stop by for the yummy food.
author: J S.

description:
Dai Gai Bao (Chinese Chicken Bun) for $1.25 

This was wonderful. There was chicken, pork, cabbage, mushroom, egg and chinese sausage inside. Delicious.

I also enjoy their Hong Dou Sui Beng (chinese mochi with red bean paste) for 40 cents. This one is a bit chewier than the norm, but i like texture so this may not be everyone's favorite.

I'm not a fan of their lo po beng (wife cake) or baked cha sui bao (bbq pork bun), but that's fine. Their chicken bun is awesome.

can't tell what piece(s) of pork this is... which makes me slightly wary.
author: Jennifer N.

description: YUMMY is all I have to say for this place. Not just great bang for your buck but the customer service is excellent. We have always had a great experience and great food when coming here. ENJOY
author: Maria L.

description: if you want satisfying, cheap yet delicious Chinese food, you HAVE to check out J&A. they are a mom and pop, no fuss, hole-in-the-wall spot that satisfies my Chinese food needs. its CASH ONLY which is okay anyways because their food is well priced. $6-8 will get you a huge helping of Chinese favorites. i recommend the double mushroom chicken over fried rice rice plate. NOM NOM NOM. SO BOMB. try this spot out. you wont regret it. :)
author: RegineAnne E.

description:
A great place for some home cooked  Chinese food. A quaint restaurant that's clean, friendly, and affordable. I think one good way to judge the cleanliness of a food establishment is by the upkeep and maintenance of the bathroom. If it's in a horrible state and reminiscent of an outhouse in a third world country, who knows what's going on in the kitchen. Here, the bathroom is clean and well maintained and nothing to worry about.

Besides that, the food is cooked fresh when you order and very tasty. My favorites are the curry chicken, lemon chicken, salted shrimp, and the thick water bottle-sized egg rolls. I should also mention that the portions are very generous and filling, even for a glutton like myself. 

It's a family owned and operated, literally a mom and pop shop. So, you can trust that the meals they're feeding you is the same good food that they feed themselves. Word.
author: Epicurious M.

description: She welcomes everyone and treats you like family.  Mom & Pop, for real.  Pop cooks, Mom runs the house!  I crave spicy Mongolian Shrimp over Fried Rice.  My Dad gets the BBQ w/ crack gravy over rice.  Prices are affordable, no MSG, comforting.  It's close to my office and it takes all I've got to keep from going there daily lol!
author: D C.

description: This cute little hole in the wall mom and pop kinda place is just what I was looking for ....I was a little sceptical at first because it was like a ghost town in there but the older grandmother type lady was super sweet to us and cracked a few jokes ...so the potstickers are a must !! They come out nice and hot ..the chow fun was super yummy with just the right amount of gravy to coat the noodles yet not drown them the lemon chicken was ridiculously good !!! I mean I could really taste the lemons in it and the broccoli beef with Hong Hong style pan fried noodles was really good...I took my little brother and sister and there pretty picky but they tore the food up so that should tell you something . The only down fall is that we didn't get our rice until almost half way through. But the oranges,fortune cookies ,and mini candy bars
author: christina a.

description: I love this place, the price is cheap and they give big portions.  I really hope they get more customers since the server/owner is so nice.  And the taste is amazing, I usually get szechaun sauce chicken over chow mein (its not on the menu) and I'm currently in love with it.
author: Benny H.

description:
the good here was AWESOME! its really tiny and not a place for a first date nor for a romantic setting but the food is really authentic and cheap!! I'd definitely go here again. The Chicken frice rice, chicken mongolian and orange chicken were to die for!!!!!! I'm craving it now and can't drive two hours to get it but I would if I had the time!! 
=]

Must go!! Prices Cheap. Authentic food. Wonderful service.
author: manisha c.

description: Best fried rice ever!!!! I love this place!
author: Elaine P.

description: I think the woman who runs this restaurant could possibly be the nicest restaurateur in the world. I told her I liked her amazing chili sauce/oil and she gave us tons of little containers of it. Then, after thinking for a few seconds, she gave us 1/2 QUART of it. She also throws in stuff for free if you order a lot of stuff. And the prices are already SO low. We ordered tons of food for 5 adults and have enough leftovers for at least another round for us ALL (so that is 10 meals) for $50. The food itself is pretty good, too. We got beef and broccoli, chicken chow mein (big hit with the baby), chicken fried rice, sweet and sour chicken (which has a comfy, fried flavor), mixed veggies with tofu, ma po tofu with pork (REALLY good here, and I've had that all over the city), and potstickers. All the food is good and did I say that the lady is just so nice. I think everyone should go here and eat so that she can stay in business. It is always empty when I pick stuff up, but I think they do a brisk take-out service. I would actually recommend take-out because the restaurant itself isn't a destination or anything. I found this place while looking for Chinese delivery and they do not deliver, but it is worth the drive no matter where you are coming from.
author: Jody S.

description: Had the sweet & sour pork, was pretty tasty. i would recommend.
author: Pascual G.

description: Definitely not worthy of 4 1/2 stars!  This is a neighborhood place, primarily for take-out.  The food is old-school Chinese-American comfort food--thick and gunky and heavy on the MSG.  Being inexpensive, it could be considered good value.  The portions are generous, and the old lady who runs it is nice in her own reserved way.  The decor and condition of the restaurant are very "third-world" (you know, like you're in some impoverished foreign country).  I gave it a try because my mother lives a mile away, but I doubt that I'll ever go back. If I lived nearby however, I might order take-out from them occasionally and try different things on the menu (other than the Beef and Broccoli).
author: John B.

description: If you want good  Chinese food at a decent price I  recommend J and A the lady there is always nice and she greets you with a big smile every time, if your like me and you take your food to go, she will give you a fortune cookie And an candy bar along with your eating utensils, I give her a 5 star rating for good food and service with a smile..
author: Poo B.

description:
This place is decent b/c of the price and the fact that I live a few blocks away so it's easy for me to pick up w/o driving. 
It is owned by a chinese couple, very nice pple. 
I ate there twice and take out only. The main reason I don't order more often, is b/c they don't have most of the stuff on their menu. If you simply want typical american styled rice plates, then they would have it. But Im Chinese and i sometimes want noodle soup or stewed beef brisket, which they don't have.
So, I did try their curry chicken and asked for extra spicy and it was decently spicy so that is a plus. Their mangolian beef was decently spicy also. i just don't recommend their soups, its not worth paying for it unless u are really carving for msg quick boiled type of soup.
author: Ettolrahc M.

description: I love this place! they have great Curry Chicken! and the owner is a blast!!!
author: Jessica T.

description: I sometimes eat here on the way home to Daly City.  As another reviewer stated, the Mongolian beef over rice is excellent, and their sweet & sour dishes are delicious.  The chicken with corn soup has always tasted fresh, and the mixed vegetables with chicken as well incl. bitter melon etc. which one doesn't taste in some of the more Westernized Chinese restaurants.  It is convenient for take-out, and once you know the neighborhood parking is not a problem.  I have come to realize that some smaller rest's off the beaten track may not have their entire menu on hand, and the owners usually recommend some appropriately similar dish if that is the case.  I would recommend for casual/take-out.
author: John W.

description:
I always like hole in the walls.  That's what this is.

Good Chinese food, and friendly service.  I've ordered take out from here twice on weeknights where I don't have time to cook and the food is good.  Standard Chinese fair that I grew up with from places in the Sunset, but here's one in Daly City.  I've tried the mongolian beef, szchuan chicken, salted fish fried rice, tomato beef chow mein (yum) and the dish with which I measure all Chinese Restaurants - beef chow fun.  All have been good and are decently priced at around $5-6.

Really nice lady is always there when I order.  She includes a package of utensils and candy with the orders.  Candy!  A nice touch, unless you're allergic to chocolate.  My first time there, I walked in, ordered out and waited.  The lady handed me a menu and told me to order via phone so I wouldn't have to wait next time.  Nice, unexpected and motherly, but nice.

I'll keep ordering from here - it's my fav after trying a few other chinese restaurants around the neighborhood.
author: Michael F.

description: I have been coming here for about 2-3 years now and every week I always order the mongolian beef over rice or with pan fried noodles. The curry fish is always very good and the curry shrimp chow mien.
author: Kelvin H.

description:
I'd say 3.5 stars.  The cheap factor pushed it over into 4.
The lemon chicken was fabulous, really good.  The hot and sour soup, very good, shrimp and scallops not so good.  My son had mixed vegetables and rice noodles and was very happy, large portion and it was good.  Not much for vegetarians which always a problem for us.  All that for $28.00.
comfortable hole in the wall, and will go back.
author: jesse e.

description:
good,
affordable,
comfortable,
that's all folks....
author: Emilio J.

description: I came here with a few friends and it was nice. The place is small, and is in an older building, a bit of a dive. The food was a great bargain and was tasty. We got chow mein, sweet and sour pork and lemon chicken, as well as egg rolls and pot stickers. This was more than enough food for the four of us. The lady that took our order was the owner of the place i think. She was very nice and friendly. She brought us some sliced oranges and  was chatting with us after we were done eating. I'd eat here again.
author: Thomas B.

description: Good food. Great prices. Friendly mom and pop. Much better than any new Chinese joint I,ve tried in a long while. M.S.G.? Can't tell(doesn't bother me anyway). I felt bad about the plastic to-go containers. I'll just have to walk around the corner and eat off a plate.
author: Boxxxman J.

description: Fresh, good, hot food every time I walk in the door. What a culinary treat!  I will be back for more. I salivate when I think about the spices. I will keep dreaming about this food until I return.
author: carol b.

description: I eat at J&A about once a week.  They have the best Chinese food of any restaurant I have eaten at.  No MSG seasoned to your personal taste.  Simply the best.  A truly Mom and Pop place, they are the real deal folks.  I can  not think of a place I would rather eat than there.  Especially for the price.  Try the Mongolian Beef over crispy noodle,so good!
author: james s.

description: Absolutely delicious! Hole in the wall indeed - if not for the that, would be 5 stars.
author: J B.

description: I thought the food was awesome here. People are right though. Parking sucks. Affordable (definitely) and they make it easy to not eat out if you don't have the money too (cash only!). Plan to take my mom here when she comes to visit - she loves Chinese food!
author: Angela B.

description: this place's got some good chinese food for great price. try the mongolian beef. it's awesome. the people there are cool and friendly. don't forget to get the egg rolls. can't have chinese food without 'em egg rolls.
author: big k.
